title.native: 劇場版 魔法少女まどか★マギカ [新編] 叛逆の物語
title.romaji: Gekijouban Mahou Shoujo Madoka★Magica: Shinpen - Hangyaku no Monogatari
title.english: Puella Magi Madoka Magica: The Movie -Rebellion-

description:
With Madoka Kaname's sacrifice, the hopeless cycle that once bound every magical girl to a terrible fate was broken at last. Still, the magical girls fight on against the dark magics that threaten the human world, which remains ignorant of the brave girl who saved them. Only Homura remembers her dear friend Madoka, a burden she has borne in all her battles since-right? Then how is Homura still going to school with Madoka, fighting alongside her, laughing as if nothing has happened? As her tragic memories return to her, Homura realizes she must not be in the real world, wonderful as it is to see her friend again. But if she is indeed trapped in a magical space, who among her magical friends could be the cause?

(Source: Yen Press)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

title.native: 劇場版 魔法少女まどか☆マギカ 叛逆の物語
魔法少女まどか☆マギカ [魔獣編]

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Butch_Gen)

Gen Urobuchi is a Japanese novelist and screenwriter. He is a key member of the video game and visual novel developer [Nitroplus](https://anilist.co/studio/459/Nitroplus) and currently serves as the company's representative director and vice-president.

He is best known as the co-creator of the highly acclaimed and commercially successful anime series [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Puella-Magi-Madoka-Magica/), which earned him the Tokyo Anime Award for Best Scriptwriter. His other major works include the acclaimed Nitroplus-developed visual novel, *Saya no Uta*, the anime series [PSYCHO-PASS](https://anilist.co/anime/13601/PSYCHOPASS/), the light novel and anime series [Fate/Zero](https://anilist.co/anime/10087/FateZero/), and the tokusatsu TV show *Kamen Rider Gaim*. Urobuchi is one of the most renowned and prolific writers in the anime industry.

Anime series written by Urobuchi that have won the Newtype Anime Award have been Puella Magi Madoka Magica in 2011, Fate/Zero in 2012 and [Psycho-Pass: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/20514/PSYCHOPASS-The-Movie/) in 2015.

A film buff, Urobuchi likes to include film homages in his works. He has named Kiyoshi Kurosawa, Sergio Leone, and John Carpenter to be his favorite directors. As a child, he also loved robot animation and cited [Armored Trooper Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/Armored-Trooper-Votoms/) as one of his influences.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Phantom -PHANTOM OF INFERNO- (Visual Novel, 2000) (Scenario)
- Vampirdzhija Vjedogonia (Visual Novel, 2001) (Director, Scenario)
- Kikokugai: The Cyber Slayer (Visual Novel, 2002) (Director, Scenario)
- "Hello, world." (Visual Novel, 2002) (Original Concept, Planning, Debug)
- Deus Machina Demonbane (Visual Novel, 2003) (Director)
- Saya no Uta ~ The Song of Saya (Visual Novel, 2003) (Director, Scenario)
- Zoku Satsuriku no Django -Jigoku no Shoukinkubi- (Visual Novel, 2007) (Scenario, Planning)
- Kamen Rider Gaim (Tokusatsu, TV series, 2013) (Series Composition, Script)
- Thunderbolt Fantasy (TV series, 2016) (Original Creator, Chief Supervision, Script)
!~

[Twitter](http://twitter.com/hanokage) | [Pixiv](http://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=49138) | [Website](http://hano.pepper.jp/)

She is an illustrator and mangaka. Noted for her work on the manga adaptation of Puella Magi Madoka Magica, as well as other spin-off and one-shot manga related to the series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/williamflanagan)

William (Bill) Flanagan started translating manga professionally in 1991 and has been translating and editing manga ever since. He rose to be Director of Editorial of Viz Media in the early 2000s and from then on, has had his hand in top-selling manga. He also translates anime, games, TV, movies and novels. He lives with his wife and son in the mountains of Gifu Prefecture, Japan.

Magica Quartet is a collaboration between the main staff for Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica and its movie version. It consists of director [Akiyuki Shinbo](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/Akiyuki-Shinbou), writer [Gen Urobuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/105308/Gen-Urobuchi), character designer [Aoki Ume](https://anilist.co/staff/97969/Ume-Aoki) and producer [Atsuhiro Iwakami](https://anilist.co/staff/109031/Atsuhiro-Iwakami).

[Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/abigail-blackman) | [Twitter](https://x.com/dydreemblvr) | [Etsy](https://www.etsy.com/shop/dydreemblvr/?etsrc=sdt)

Thriving on doing a bit of everything, Abigail has been working in the US manga industry since 2008. Since leaving her in-house editorial role in 2013, Abigail has undertaken a wide range of freelance assignments including editing and localizing translated scripts; lettering and retouching for manga interiors; and designing promotional items, ads, and cover logos.
When she isn't panels-deep in a new manga project, Abigail enjoys various other creative pursuits, as well as generally being out of doors.
